channel.title: Laptop advice
channel.description:
My brother is looking for a laptop. Since I am the one with the most knowledge about computers in my family, he asks me for advice about wether he should or should not buy an Acer Aspire 9302WSMi. He only needs it for making documents and browsing the net, and sporadicly for older games like Red Alert 1.
Product info: CPU: AMD Turion 64 X2 TL-50, 1600 MHz HDD: 120Gb, 5400 rpm RAM: 2x 1 Gb DDR2 SDRAM nVIDIA GeForce Go 7300
Price: [s]No idea really, but probably a max of €500[/s] He has to pay €475 for it.
In my eyes it's not bad for his needs, but if I were to buy a laptop I wouldn't buy this one. What do you guys think?
Way to expensive, right?

item.title: Laptop advice
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Probably, I really just hate any major brand name of computers lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop advice
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:7, topic:237127”][quote author=cooper link=topic=313113.msg2497937#msg2497937 date=1224483240]
I’d have to recommend HP. Good warranty, good hardware, reasonable price.
[/quote]

After the warranty is up, kurplunk. Or at least that’s what I’ve experienced with 3 HP’s over the past 10 years.[/quote]
Really? I’ve been able to renew the warranty every time, so pretty much all HP’s I’ve bought a warranty for are still covered - maybe I’m just lucky though.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop advice
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

I got mine with:

  • AMD Athlon Dual-Core QL-60
  • 2GB RAM
  • NVIDIA GeForce 8200M G

For $499 Canadian dollar, which was more powerful then the american dollar (about a month ago).

So yes, that would be way too much.
